summary: The Veterans PTSD Screening Act (H.R. 3886) directs the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to conduct a study using RNA sequencing to determine if it can effectively diagnose Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) in veterans. The study will be conducted in five Veterans Integrated Service Networks within 120 days of the bill's enactment and must conclude by September 30, 2027. A report detailing the results of the study must be submitted to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs of the Senate and House of Representatives by September 30, 2028.
